medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive fat deposition of the neck, face, and upper back.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 5 years prior to presentation, characterized by progressive fat deposition. The patient experienced deterioration in range of motion in the neck due to increasing fat deposition, along with muscle wasting and severe proximal myopathy. The patient reported worsening discomfort and distress over physical deformity, leading to treatment for depression.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was hepatitis B-positive but human immunodeficiency virus-negative. No relevant past medical conditions concerning the lipodystrophy were specified.
medical_history.family_history: The patient denied any familial history of lipodystrophy.
medical_history.social_history: The patient did not smoke tobacco or consume alcohol and denied exogenous steroid use. No other relevant social history was specified.
